abstractText: Standard lengthis the distance from the anterior-most extreme of the head (jaw closed) to the posterior margin of the hypural bone as manifested by the notch created by flexing the caudal peduncle (see fish measurement image; Anderson and Gutreuter 1983).Only measure for standard length if the fish specimen cannot be measured using the maximum total length method (Method ID: 1551)orthefork length method (Method ID: 4041; for those species in which fork length measurements are appropriate) due to damaged or deformed caudal fins.
title: Measuring Fish Length: Standard Length for Fish in Large River Systems v1.0
